title: Five surprising MLB performances -- and why they're happening
content: We break down a breakout bat, a prospect finally coming into his own, a power hitter who has stopped hitting home runs, and more.

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
content: While NL powerhouses duke it out at the top, a new club is leading the way in the AL, with two others also on the up.

title: Curry calls injury a 'gut punch,' won't rush return
content: Calling the situation "a gut punch," Stephen Curry said he knows he has to be careful and can't rush his return given the "tricky" nature of hamstring injuries.

title: Brandon Miller testifies he was nearly shot in '23
content: Brandon Miller testified Thursday that he was almost struck by bullets fired into his car during a January 2023 shooting that killed Jamea Harris near The Strip in Tuscaloosa.

title: Lemon, WS champ and 3-time All-Star, dies at 70
content: Chet Lemon, a three-time All Star and World Series champion with the 1984 Detroit Tigers, has died at the age of 70.

title: Pirates fire Shelton, say move is to 'fix this now'
content: Derek Shelton's dismissal as manager comes as the Pirates (12-26) have lost seven straight games and 10 of 11. Pirates chairman Bob Nutting said the team needed to "act with a sense of urgency and take the steps necessary to fix this now."

title: Cheapest Celts-Knicks G3 resale ticket over $600
content: Ticket demand is so great for Game 3 of the NBA playoff series between the Boston Celtics and New York Knicks that it will cost a fan more than $600 on the resale market just to get in to Madison Square Garden on Saturday.

title: Quenneville hired to coach Ducks in NHL return
content: The Ducks have hired Joel Quenneville as their new coach, marking the former Blackhawks and Panthers coach's return to the NHL.

title: Bird gets newly made role on U.S. women's team
content: Sue Bird is giving another assist to USA Basketball, becoming the first managing director of the women's national team.

title: üéµ King of TikTok: 'LeBron James' song trend
content: Professional athletes have long been name-dropped in hip-hop songs, but R&B songs comprised solely of LeBron and Curry's names? That's a more recent phenomenon.

title: What should we expect from Shedeur Sanders in Cleveland?
content: Fifth-round draft picks don't typically carry the weight of expectations. Ahead of his first NFL practice, what's realistic for Sanders in a Browns uniform?

title: The biggest remaining roster hole for every NFL team: Where all 32 could still upgrade
content: Teams have added to their rosters through free agency, trades and the draft, but they all have at least one position that still needs a boost.

title: NFL experts debate the draft: Which midround picks could be fantasy sleepers?
content: A dozen experts weigh in on the draft with their top picks, Rookie of the Year predictions and fantasy sleepers.

title: Post-spring Way-Too-Early Top 25: Where do Texas and Notre Dame rank?
content: Where do the top teams stand after spring practice and roster movement from the transfer portal? Mark Schlabach updates the rankings.

title: GM is the new gold rush for college football
content: The general manager position is exploding in college football as more and more NFL personnel get involved.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can the Capitals, Golden Knights get revenge in Game 2?
content: The Hurricanes and Oilers won the first game of their respective series. Here's what to watch on Thursday.

title: At long last, Michigan State aligns with Larry Nassar survivors
content: Nassar survivors and MSU president Kevin Guskiewicz announced a new assessment of the school's culture.

title: Projecting how good the expansion Valkyries will be in their inaugural WNBA season
content: Historically, WNBA expansion teams have struggled in their first season. How many games might Golden State win in 2025?

title: Ranking the Red Sox's options at first base: Devers back in the infield? A prospect moving positions?
content: Boston has plenty of in-house options to fill a sudden need. Here's what those in the game think is the best choice.

title: Top prospects for the 2025 NHL draft: Updated rankings after U18s, draft lottery
content: There's a consensus on the top four -- after that, all bets are off. Who will your team select in June?

title: Champions League final: Inter or PSG? Our experts make their picks
content: ESPN writers gaze into their crystal balls to predict who will be crowned European champions at Munich's Allianz Arena on May 31, Inter or PSG.

title: Beckham, Neville complete Salford City takeover
content: Salford City have been acquired by a new ownership group led by former England internationals David Beckham and Gary Neville, who were already investors in the club.

title: Man United great Evra's MMA debut postponed
content: Former France and Manchester United player Patrice Evra's mixed martial arts debut has been postponed.

title: Kerr, Mewis announce birth of their first child
content: United States women's national team midfielder Kristie Mewis and her partner, Chelsea striker Sam Kerr, have announced the birth of their first child.

title: PSG keeper credits Mother Nature for UCL heroics
content: Gianluigi Donnarumma's thanked Mother Nature for his heroics against Arsenal as Paris Saint-Germain booked their ticket for the UCL final in Munich

title: Haaland blames lack of 'hunger' for poor season
content: Erling Haaland has said there are no excuses for Man City's season and said it has happened because he and his teammates "haven't been good enough."

title: 3 hospitalized, 43 arrested as PSG reach UCL final
content: One person was in critical condition and two others also hospitalised after being hit by a car amid street partying by Paris Saint-Germain fans.

title: PSG boss relieved to avoid ex-club in UCL final
content: Paris Saint-Germain coach Luis Enrique is relieved to be facing Inter Milan and not former club Barcelona in the Champions League final on May 31.

title: Setting records and continuing a legacy: CJ Kirst is carrying on his family name
content: CJ Kirst is just the latest Kirst to make a name for himself and is leading Cornell into the NCAA tournament.

title: How NASCAR drivers keep their cool in 140-degree cockpits
content: NASCAR cockpits can reach 140 degrees, so how do drivers keep cool? The answer is liquid-cooled clothing.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Inoue retains spot, Canelo falls after lackluster performance
content: Where do Naoya Inoue and Canelo Alvarez land after winning their fights this past weekend? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Betting buzz: Bettors sticking with Celtics despite Knicks' 2-0 lead
content: Despite dropping the first two games, bettors are still picking the Boston Celtics in their series against the New York Knicks.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Rantanen new Conn Smythe fave after hat trick
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: The ultimate guide to your draft
content: Andr√© Snellings provides a blueprint to follow for fantasy women's basketball drafts including his ideal selections in each round.

title: Cl√°sico kits: Barcelona, Real Madrid's all-time best, worst jerseys
content: El Cl√°sico is a clash of two of the world's most recognizable teams, Barcelona and Real Madrid. Both have iconic kits and shocking shirts in their closets.

title: Ancelotti's Real Madrid limbo explained: Why he could leave, and what comes next
content: As Carlo Ancelotti prepares for what appears to be his final Cl√°sico, how could his last few weeks play out?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Napoli aim to beat Liverpool to De Bruyne
content: Napoli will make a concrete attempt to sign Kevin De Bruyne in the coming weeks. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: BCCI could opt to halt IPL 2025 keeping the nation's sentiment in mind
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, the BCCI is contemplating halting the IPL. The DC vs PBKS match in Dharamsala was disrupted, prompting evacuation plans for players and staff. Overseas players are anxious, awaiting assurances from the BCCI and the government. The IPL Governing Council is meeting to decide the tournament's future, guided by government directives, while teams adjust travel plans.

title: US secy speaks to Jaishankar, Pakistan PM, urges 'immediate de-escalation'
content: Amid escalating tensions, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio urged India and Pakistan to de-escalate immediately, speaking with S Jaishankar and Shehbaz Sharif. He emphasized US support for direct dialogue and asked Pakistan to end support for terrorist groups, following retaliatory air strikes and India's Operation Sindoor. Blackouts have been enforced in border regions of Jammu, Punjab and Rajasthan.

title: Elon Musk warns 'All life on Earth will be destroyed by...'
content: Elon Musk, SpaceX founder, warns of the sun's eventual destruction of Earth, advocating for Mars colonization as humanity's long-term survival strategy. He emphasizes the urgency of establishing a self-sustaining civilization on Mars, viewing it as "life insurance" for humanity. SpaceX is actively developing plans for Martian habitats and addressing the challenges of establishing a permanent colony.

title: Right to reside in India only for citizens, Rohingya must go: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court declined to halt the deportation of illegal Rohingya Muslim migrants from Delhi, emphasizing that the right to reside in India is exclusive to citizens. The court acknowledged the migrants' right to life but affirmed they would be handled under the Foreigners Act. The Solicitor General assured due process while highlighting national security concerns and India's non-recognition of Rohingya refugees.

title: 1971 wasn‚Äôt half as terrifying for shell-shocked Poonch
content: Poonch endured intense Pakistani bombardment, unlike anything experienced even during the 1971 war, prompting widespread fear and displacement. Shelling damaged religious sites and homes, resulting in casualties, including a tabla player, a kirtan singer and a maulvi. Residents are now fleeing, seeking safety as they express the urgent need for civilian bunkers amidst escalating tensions.

title: Uri‚Äôs 72 hours: Tuesday‚Äôs peace, Wednesday‚Äôs fire, Thursday‚Äôs ashes
content: Heavy Pakistani shelling has devastated Nowpora village in Uri, leaving residents like Tahir Talib homeless after his house was destroyed. The intense mortar fire forced families to flee, seeking refuge in Baramulla and Boniyar.  Amidst the ruins and shuttered markets, villagers return briefly to salvage belongings and protect livestock, hoping for an end to the violence that has shattered their lives.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos loses World's Second-Richest man title to...
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: PM asks top officers to ensure 'fool-proof' functioning of essential system
content: Following the successful air-strikes in Pakistan, Prime Minister Modi directed key secretaries to ensure the readiness and security of essential systems. He emphasized seamless coordination among ministries for operational continuity and instructed proactive action on supply chains and infrastructure security. Departments are closely monitoring commodity prices and combating misinformation to maintain stability during potential escalations.

title: Land-for-jobs case: President grants permission to prosecute Lalu
content: President Murmu has sanctioned the prosecution of Lalu Prasad in the railways jobs-for-land case, paving the way for a fast-tracked trial. The ED's chargesheets accuse Lalu and associates of accepting land as bribes for railway jobs during his tenure as minister. This sanction allows for daily hearings in a special court, expediting trials in both CBI and ED cases involving alleged corruption and money laundering.

title: Don't be surprised if the two NCP factions unite: Sharad Pawar
content: Sharad Pawar's recent hint about a potential reunion between the two NCP factions has stirred political discussions, suggesting his daughter Supriya Sule may discuss the matter with Ajit Pawar. This development introduces uncertainty for the MVA alliance, as both NCP factions show positive signs towards reconciliation. Simultaneously, speculation arises about a possible reunion between Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS, prompting Congress to reassess its strategy for Maharashtra.

title: Musk is no longer ‚ÄòElon Musk‚Äô on Twitter; changes his profile name to‚Ä¶
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Chhota Rajan granted bail in 2009 attempt to murder case
content: A special CBI court granted bail to gangster Chhota Rajan in a 2009 attempt to murder case, noting that all accused, including Surendrakumar Agrawal, have been on bail since the beginning. Despite the bail in this case, Rajan will remain in jail as he is serving a life sentence for the 2011 murder of journalist J Dey.

title: Mehbooba asks PM to pick dialogue with Pak over hostilities, cites deaths on either side
content: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urged PM Modi to prioritize dialogue with Pakistan following the Pahalgam terrorist attack, cautioning against military escalation. She highlighted the human cost of conflict, sharing images of children killed in shelling and advocating for peaceful co-existence. PDP legislator Waheed Para echoed this sentiment, emphasizing that J&K bears the brunt of India-Pakistan hostilities and stressing the need for dialogue.

title: 11 years on, Maharashtra official convicted of taking Rs 1,500 bribe
content: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), facing criticism for low conviction rates, successfully convicted a retired senior transport official in an 11-year-old bribery case. Rajendra Aknath Nerkar, along with an accomplice, was sentenced for accepting a bribe to return bus documents. This conviction highlights ACB's commitment to prosecuting high-ranking officials despite past challenges with evidence and witness availability.

title: If judges not shielded, they may seek political patronage: Ex-CJI
content: CJI-designate B R Gavai, poised to become the 52nd CJI, pledged leadership and a long-term vision for the judiciary, echoing former CJI N V Ramana's sentiments. Speaking at the release of Justice Ramana's book, Justice Gavai assured that he would follow Ramana's guidance. Justice Ramana emphasized the moral duty of the CJI and SC judges to support all judges, ensuring they feel secure and protected.

title: 14th night of Pakistan truce violation, toll rises to 16
content: Pakistan's continuous shelling across the LoC after India's response to a terrorist attack resulted in more casualties. The death toll has risen to 16 in just over 48 hours. Mortar and heavy artillery fire targeted several sectors, marking the 14th consecutive night of truce violations. Many people were wounded. The Jammu and Kashmir government ordered the closure of educational institutions in five border districts.

title: SC slams ‚Äòirresponsible‚Äô Dubey, but spares him from contempt
content: The Supreme Court rebuked BJP MP Nishikant Dubey for his "irresponsible, absurd and scandalous" allegations against the CJI-led bench regarding petitions challenging the Wakf Amendment Act. While the court declined to initiate contempt proceedings, citing its resilience against ludicrous statements, it firmly asserted that any attempt to spread communal hatred or indulge in hate speech must be dealt with an iron hand.

title: 4 Chinese held for entering India sans visa through Bihar
content: Four Chinese nationals were apprehended by Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) for illegally entering India from Nepal through Raxaul without valid visas. Interrogation revealed they intended to return to Hathaura and Lumbini in Nepal. Investigation agencies, including NIA and IB, are struggling to determine the exact purpose of their visit due to a language barrier, as the individuals primarily respond in Chinese.

title: False charge: Chennai bus conductor wins 5-year-long legal battle
content: A Metropolitan Transport Corporation (MTC) conductor, K Radhakrishnan, faced a false misconduct charge after a passenger mistakenly picked up a soiled ticket. This led to illegal salary recovery and a five-year legal battle. The Madras High Court intervened, ordering MTC to refund the recovered amount of Rs 25,200 with 6% interest and settle all pending retirement dues, highlighting the injustice he suffered.

title: Led by minister, AAP workers lock up BBMB chairman
content: Following a High Court order, tensions escalated at the Nangal dam as AAP workers, led by a minister, briefly detained the BBMB chief to prevent water release to Haryana. Punjab's CM accused the chairman of illegally diverting water and stated the diverted water has been restored to Punjab. The High Court has directed the Centre to provide details of the meeting regarding the water release and clarify dispute resolution mechanisms.

title: After 18 yrs, identical twins who used the same papers to get jobs caught
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district, a massive education fraud has been unearthed, revealing how teachers secured jobs using fake documents. Twin sisters, both named Rashmi, fraudulently worked for 18 years, costing the state over Rs 1.6 crore. Despite a High Court order, 16 teachers with confirmed irregularities remain employed, having collectively drawn nearly Rs 22.9 crore in salaries.

title: Rain and landslides shut Jammu-Srinagar highway
content: The Srinagar-Jammu National Highway, a crucial link between Kashmir and the rest of India, was shut down on Thursday due to rain-induced mudslides in Ramban. Hundreds of vehicles were stranded as landslides and shooting stones blocked the road. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for more rain in the region.

title: Operation Sindoor: Check new air travel advisory for passengers
content: Operation Sindoor impact on air travel: Following India's missile strikes, numerous airports across the country, particularly in the north and northwest, have suspended commercial flights until May 10. Airlines like IndiGo, Air India, SpiceJet, and Akasa Air have cancelled and rescheduled hundreds of flights. Enhanced security measures are in place at all airports, with passengers advised to arrive at least three hours before departure.

title: BCCI to arrange special train to evacuate players from Dharamsala
content: Following cross-border tensions, the BCCI halted the Punjab Kings versus Delhi Capitals match, prioritizing player safety. A special train is being arranged to safely transport players, staff, and the broadcast crew. The BCCI will assess the situation to decide on the tournament's future, with player safety remaining the top priority.

title: 'Pakistan have escalated the war to save its terrorist assets'
content: Tensions between India and Pakistan led to the abrupt cancellation of the IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala. Players and staff were evacuated as the BCCI scrambled to respond, with Virender Sehwag expressing strong condemnation. The league now faces rescheduling challenges amid heightened security concerns and logistical hurdles.

title: White smoke! Papal conclave elects new pope
content: Vatican City is abuzz as white smoke billows from the Sistine Chapel, signaling the election of a new Pope after two unsuccessful ballots. A cardinal will soon announce 'Habemus Papam!' from St. Peter‚Äôs Basilica, revealing the chosen cardinal's birth name and his selected papal name.

title: Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals match called off in Dharamsala
content: Due to rain at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association (HPCA) in Dharamsala, the match between Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) has been called off. Earlier, Shreyas Iyer of Punjab Kings won the toss and chose to bat in the rain-delayed match against Delhi Capitals. DC made one change, replacing Vipraj Nigam with Madhav Tiwari, while PBKS remained unchanged.

title: Pakistan targets Jammu with loitering munitions- what are they
content: Pakistan retaliated against India's Operation Sindoor by targeting Jammu with loitering munitions, mirroring the weapons India used to strike terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK. Indian forces intercepted the incoming missiles and drones, prompting blackouts in Jammu regions and parts of Punjab and Rajasthan.

title: Govt orders 100% pre-boarding checks for all flyers at all airports
content: Following the recent attack in Pahalgam, the Indian government has heightened security measures at all airports and flights nationwide. The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security has mandated secondary ladder point security checks for all passengers and banned visitor entry to terminals.

title: Did Pak shoot down Indian jets? What MEA said
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri has firmly refuted Pakistan's claims of downing Indian jets amidst heightened tensions following India's 'Operation Sindoor.' Misri highlighted Pakistan's history of falsehoods, citing instances dating back to 1947 and its alleged targeting of the Neelum-Jhelum dam.

title: Happy Mother's Day: Top 50 wishes, messages, images
content: Mother's Day, celebrated on the second Sunday of May, honors mothers and maternal figures for their love and sacrifices. Originating in the early 20th century with Anna Jarvis, it became a national holiday in 1914. The day is marked by gifts, quality time, and expressions of gratitude, with heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to make mothers feel special.

title: No BCCI pressure behind Rohit Sharma‚Äôs Test retirement: Rajeev Shukla
content: BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla confirmed that Rohit Sharma's Test retirement was his personal decision, with no pressure from the board or selection committee. While an undisputed white-ball icon, Sharma's Test performance varied, excelling at home but facing challenges overseas. Despite his Test retirement, Sharma will continue playing ODIs, allowing India to leverage his experience and talent in the format.

title: Cash-at-home row: 'CJI recommends impeachment of Justice Varma'
content: Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna has recommended the impeachment of Justice Yashwant Varma following a Supreme Court panel's indictment in a cash recovery controversy. The CJI submitted the inquiry report and Justice Varma's response to the President and Prime Minister. Justice Varma has denied the allegations in his responses to both the Delhi high court Chief Justice and the Supreme Court-appointed committee.

title: Pak exposed over Sajid Mir terror links, FATF grey list deception
content: Pakistan's shifting narrative on Sajid Mir, a key 26/11 plotter, has exposed its deception in combating terrorism, according to Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri. Initially declared a non-entity and then presumed dead, Mir's existence was later acknowledged amid pressure from the FATF.

title: On Pak's civilian killed claim, MEA replies with terrorist's funeral pic
content: India refuted Pakistan's allegations regarding civilian casualties in 'Operation Sindoor'. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri stated those eliminated were terrorists. He questioned Pakistan's state funerals for alleged civilians. Misri highlighted Pakistan's support for terrorism. He recalled Osama Bin Laden's presence in Pakistan. He mentioned the presence of UN-proscribed terrorists in Pakistan. The government previously described Operation Sindoor as focused and non-escalatory.

title: How India used 'Sudarshan Chakra' to take down Pak drones, missiles
content: In a swift response to Pakistan's aggression, India deployed its S-400 Sudarshan Chakra air defence system on May 7-8, successfully intercepting drones and missiles aimed at 15 Indian cities. The operation thwarted attempts to damage military installations, with debris recovered as evidence. India retaliated by neutralizing Pakistani air defence systems, including one in Lahore, after the attempted escalation.

title: CPI(M) calls for an all-party meeting headed by PM, special session of Parliament
content: The party expressed regret over the absence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the second consecutive time in the key all-party meeting

title: India reported 21 lakh additional deaths in 2021 compared with 2020
content: The two lockdown years reported 5,74,198 COVID-19 deaths, says report on births and deaths released  by the Registrar General of India after a gap of five years

title: ‚ÄòLudicrous‚Äô comments made by BJP MP not worthy of contempt action, says Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court termed Nishikant Dubey‚Äôs remarks, in which he had attacked the court, ‚Äúabsurd‚Äù and displaying a desire and deliberate attempt to malign the court and its judges

title: Memories of matinee idol MGR and the two lions and a bear cub that he maintained
content:
Among the belongings of the actor-turned politician displayed at his memorial house at T.¬†Nagar in Chennai is a¬†taxidermied lion, named¬†Raja.¬†It was bought, along with another cub¬†Rani, in Calcutta by MGR Pictures for some scenes in¬†Nadodi Mannan.¬†
Raja died unexpectedly, and¬†Rani was donated to the Chennai Corporation Zoo

title: Seeds, fertilizers available adequately for kharif crops: Chouhan
content: Union Agriculture Minister highlights bumper Kharif output, asserts India has ample seeds and fertilizers; praises Indus Water Treaty cancellation as boost for farmers

title: The fall of a great studio through the lens of writer¬†Ashokamitran
content: Ashokamitran‚Äôs novel,¬†Karaintha Nizhalkal, is a fictionalised version of¬†My Years with Boss¬†that recounts his days as an employee of Gemini Studios. The fall of men who once dominated the tinsel world is the central theme of both books

title: Punjab CM leads protest at BBMB; Haryana charges AAP of undermining Constitution
content: The sit-in protest at the Bhakra Beas Management Board‚Äôs Nangal office escalates tensions between Punjab and Haryana amid the ongoing water-sharing dispute

title: ‚ÄòState funeral for terrorists in Pakistan‚Äô: Foreign Secy slams Pakistan‚Äôs links to TRF, LeT, and JeM leaders
content: Pakistan‚Äôs links to designated terror groups exposed; Foreign Secy shows images of LeT leader openly leading prayers for the dead at LeT HQ near Lahore; Opposition calls for sanctions against Pakistan

title: When 43¬†LTTE militants escaped from the¬†Vellore¬†Fort after digging a 153-foot tunnel
content: The extremists, including four women, who were housed in a special camp, had dug the tunnel from a bathroom in the¬†Tippu Mahal to the moat.¬†They slipped out in batches. The daring escape sent shock waves as the camp was guarded by five watchtowers and two companies of the Central Reserve Police Force that assisted the Tamil Nadu Police

title: KARSAP: 450 pharmacy licences suspended, five cancelled¬†
content: Government directive to medical stores to not sell antibiotics without doctors‚Äô prescription had been almost fully implemented, says Veena George

title: BEST announces fare hike to boost revenue amid financial struggles
content: Mumbai residents will face a significant increase in bus fares starting May 9, with the minimum fare doubling to ‚Çπ10, marking the first fare revision since 2018

title: India‚Äôs latest MMR shows a declining trend
content: The Maternal Mortality Ratio in India fell to 93 per lakh live births in 2019-21 from 97 in 2018-20, with the highest MMR occurring in the 20-29 years age group

title: L-G directs police officials to take strict action against antisocial elements and curb sale of ganja in the Union Territory
content: The meeting, held at Raj Nivas to review the law and order situation in the region, was attended by Chief Secretary Sharat Chauhan and Director General of Police Shalini Singh. The attendees discussed in length measures to be adopted to strengthen law enforcement, improve traffic situation and on implementation of three new criminal laws.

title: MDRF, U.S. researchers call for precision treatment following discovery of a new subtype of monogenic diabetes
content: Researchers highlighted that the study opens up new avenues for precision treatment and discovery of novel drug targets in diabetes treatment

title: VACB Ernakulam unit arrests nearly 25 officials on charge of accepting bribe in last six months
content: A rise in complaints over recent months has led to an increase in the number of officials being caught red-handed while accepting bribes, says VACB official

title: Chief Minister vows to revitalise governance
content: CM asked government officials to give utmost importance to priority projects like extreme poverty eradication, LIFE Mission, Aardram

title: Micro finance staff seize house in Alnavar, KRRS office-bearers break it open
content: The State govt. has already warned micro finance institutions against harassing loanees by bringing out an Ordinance to curb it

title: K. Sudhakaran welcomes successor Sunny Joseph with open arms
content: Acknowledging responsibility ahead, Sunny Joseph said his priority would be organisational strengthening

title: Minister empowers 13 AYUSH doctors to act against persons publishing fake medical ads
content: Satya Kumar Yadav issues orders following the Supreme Court taking a serious note of false medical claims and calling for a redressal mechanism in all States

title: Congress accuses Doordarshan of labelling Kharge a ‚Äòtraitor‚Äô, demands apology from I&B Minister
content: Alleging an ‚Äòinsulting and dangerous narrative being run by Doordarshan‚Äô, Congress general secretary K.C. Venugopal said it was ‚Äòextremely divisive and completely out of place as we face a national crisis‚Äô

title: Trace DNA left by large carnivores at livestock kill sites can be used to reliably identify individual predators: NCBS study
content: NCBS said that this approach offers a powerful tool to effectively manage human-wildlife conflict and understand predator behaviour and ecology

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates:  "Operations Remain Normal," Says Delhi Airport
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: The Indian armed forces foiled fresh attempts by the Pakistani military to target northern and western cities using drones and missiles on Thursday evening, sources said.

title: Operation Sindoor: 24 Airports Shut, Blackouts In Several Cities After Pak Strikes
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: India thwarted Pakistan's attempts at targeting 15 places in the country amid rising tension between the two countries, a fallout of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pathankot on April 22 that killed 26 people.

title: Punjab Shuts All Education Institutes For 3 Days, Cancels Leaves Of Police
content: The Punjab government on Thursday ordered the closure of all educational institutions for the next three days and cancelled the leaves of all police personnel amid escalating tensions along the India-Pakistan border.

title: Power Restored In Chandigarh Hours After Sirens Sounded, Blackout
content: Amid a missile and drone attack by Pakistan in parts of Jammu and Kashmir and shelling in Punjab's Pathankot, sirens have been sounded in Chandigarh and a blackout has been enforced. Shops have been asked to close and people have been asked to go hom

title: Delhi On High Alert, Government Employees' Leave Cancelled Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: A high alert was sounded in Delhi, and all city government employees' leaves were cancelled as hostilities ramped up between India and Pakistan, with several border areas, including Jammu, coming under cross-border shelling.

title: "Pahalgam Attack Was Original Escalation": India On 'Op Sindoor' Response
content: The attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam on April 22 was the "original escalation", Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said on Thursday as he gave details about India's 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: India Likely To Urge IMF To Exercise Caution On Bailout Package To Pakistan
content: A day ahead of a crucial meeting of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in Washington, India on Thursday hinted that it could communicate its view to the global financial body on its bailout package for Pakistan.

title: All You Need To Know About Robert Francis Prevost: First Pope From US
content: Robert Francis Prevost, the first pope from the United States, has a history of missionary work in Peru but also a keen grasp of the inner workings of the Church.

title: Airlines Ask Passengers To Arrive 3 Hours Before Flight Amid India-Pak Tension
content: Several airlines, including Air India, IndiGo and SpiceJet, advised passengers to arrive at their respective airports at least three hours before scheduled departure on Thursday amid rising India-Pak tensions.

title: India Foils Pakistani Attack On Military Bases, Blackouts In Border Areas
content: Pakistan, hours after its foiled attempt to target 15 Indian cities, launched an attack on parts of Jammu and Kashmir. While the border areas are under heavy shelling,  Jammu is being targeted with missiles and drones.

title: Under Heavy Shelling From Pakistan, J&K's Rajouri Refuses To Bow Down
content: Rajouri, once a well-known pit-stop in Buddhist journeys and mentioned in ancient texts, is now a district where families shelter behind faith and sandbags.

title: "Historic": Notable Figures React To Cardinal Prevost Becoming Pope Leo XIV
content: Cardinal Robert Prevost was elected in a surprise choice to be the new leader of the Catholic Church on Thursday, taking the name Leo XIV, becoming the first U.S. pontiff.

title: X To Block Over 8,000 Accounts In India After Government Order
content: The microblogging website X (formerly Twitter) will block over 8,000 accounts in India following the government's order to do so, the Elon Musk-run company said today.

title: S Jaishankar Speaks To US Secretary Of State Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Thursday night spoke to US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and conveyed to him that India will firmly counter any attempts by Pakistan to escalate the situation.

title: Indian-Origin Man, 37, Stabbed To Death Inside Bank Branch In England
content: A 37-year-old man stabbed to death while inside a bank branch in the eastern England city of Derby has been formally identified as Gurvinder Johal.

title: 24 Airports Shut Amid Pakistan's Missile Attacks. See List
content: Twenty-four airports across the country were shut on Thursday amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, after the latter launched fresh missile and drone attacks in the Indian territory.

title: "Unwavering Solidarity": Gautam Adani Amid Escalation By Pakistan
content: Amid an escalation by Pakistan, Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has said it is in times like these that the world witnesses India's true strength.

title: Adani Group Signs Pact With Bhutan's Druk Green Power Corporation For 5,000 MW Of Hydropower Project
content: Chairman of Adani Group, Gautam Adani, on Thursday, thanked Prime Minister of Tshering Tobgay after Adani Group and the Druk Green Power Corporation (DGPC) of Bhutan signed a landmark Memorandum of Understanding (MoU).

title: Robert Francis Prevost Is New Pope, Takes Papal Name Pope Leon XIV
content: US Cardinal Robert Prevost was elected in a surprise choice to be the new leader of the Catholic Church on Thursday, taking the name Leo XIV, becoming the first American pontiff.

title: Congress banks on Christian-Nair equation through Sunny Joseph
content: Congress high command is hoping to re-experiment the successful Christian-Nair binary ahead of this year‚Äôs local body elections and 2026 Assembly polls

title: Former Chief Secretary Sarada Muraleedharan to open The Hindu Civil Service Gateway Summit 2025 on Friday
content: The summit brings together a power-packed line-up of serving civil servants, UPSC toppers, subject experts, and premier coaching institutes to deliver a comprehensive and career-defining experience for aspirants preparing for the 2026-27 examination cycle

title: Drive launched to enforce trade licence compliance
content: In the financial year 2024-25, only 2,300 traders took licences contributing ‚Çπ35 lakh in fees. The Corporation aims to increase the number to 6,000 licences by end of July, 2025

title: Nine killed, eight injured in gas cylinder blast in Rajasthan‚Äôs Bikaner
content: Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma condoled the deaths in the mishap and assured swift medical aid to those injured

title: Stage being set for launch of Indira Solar Giri Water Development scheme¬†  ¬†
content: Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka reviews implementation of the scheme to be launched by Chief Minister Revanth Reddy on May 18¬†¬†

title: AP Chambers suggests development of coastal beach corridor between Suryalanka and Vadarevu
content: The picturesque 20-km-long coastline, which features pristine white sand beaches, has immense potential for tourism growth, says its president P. Bhaskara Rao

title: Nellore Municipal Corporation takes multiple steps to curb mosquito menace in city
content: Special campaign started to offer under ground drainage connection to residents for just one rupee, says Municipal Commissioner Y.O. Nandan

title: Suspected malfunctioning of cold storage unit at district hospital in Aluva
content: A complaint was filed at the Aluva East police station alleging that a body kept in the mortuary of the district hospital was found in a decomposed state when the relatives of the deceased came to receive it

title: Nipah resurfaces in Malappuram with woman testing positive
content: She was hospitalised a week ago with Nipah-related symptoms, including fever and convulsions. Health Minister says emergency surveillance measures are being imposed to prevent the spread of the virus

title: Soon BMTC to launch Smart ETMs for seamless digital ticketing experience for commuters¬†
content: BMTC has floated a tender recently for these Android-based handheld devices, which will be used by conductors to issue tickets and process digital payments in real time.¬†

title: Small snail infestation in Idukki‚Äôs cardamom sector a growing threat
content: Small snails are devouring the new panicles and flowers of cardamom plants leading to significant crop damage, say farmers

title: BMRCL deploys AI-powered CCTV camera surveillance between Baiyappanahalli and M.G. Road
content: Commissioned on May 6, the system is designed to monitor not just the interiors of stations but also their peripheries, enabling real-time threat detection and anomaly tracking through AI-powered video analytics, according to BMRCL officials.¬†¬†

title: 11 sentenced to life imprisonment in double murder case in Kurnool
content: They were convicted for the killing of YSRCP leader Kangati Lakshmi Narayana Reddy and his associate in 2017

title: PIB cautions against ‚ÄòPakistan-sponsored propaganda‚Äô, flags false claims
content: The unit, which functions under the Information & Broadcasting Ministry, said Pakistan-based handles were circulating an old image claiming that a Pakistani missile had hit an Indian S-400

title: Open drains turn death-traps in Vijayawada, five die in two years
content: The drowning of a seven-year-old boy on May 4, 2025 in Gunadala area triggers public outcry for safety measures by municipal authorities such as covering the drains to avert danger

title: Vizhinjam port‚Äôs Chinese link raises questions over next phase of procurement plans
content: A Union government order has placed restrictions on public procurement from countries sharing land borders with India, citing national security

title: Action plan took Ariyalur to top position in Class XII pass percentage in Tamil Nadu, says official
content: Daily coaching before and after school hours, regular tests, and conducting monthly reviews to analyse school‚Äôs performance helped us improve the pass percentage, says Chief Education Officer of Ariyalur district

title: Keltron, C-MET join hands to launch sensor-manufacturing hub in Thrissur
content: Facility is envisioned as a hub for sensor innovation, including an incubation centre for sensor technologies, development of sensor-integrated chips, and production of key electronic components

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu instructs officials to adhere to protocol
content: Pointing out the deviations at the pubic meeting organised for the restart of the Amaravati capital construction, he asks officials to focus on such issues next time

title: Circle Inspector of Police suspended for security lapse during CM‚Äôs event
content: Police Commissioner Iada Martin Marbianang has suspended Camp Police Station Inspector Altaf Hussain Mulla on the charge of security lapse

title: I‚Äôm a trained pilot ready to serve the country: Lalu‚Äôs elder son Tej Pratap Yadav
content: In a social media post, the elder son of Bihar Opposition party Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Prasad Yadav shares a picture of himself in uniform, along with four colleagues, and copies of his licence

title: Over 40 tmcft of water to be released for 3.64 lakh acres in Nellore district: Endowments Minister
content: Another 16 tmcft of water will be released from the Telugu Ganga project for 35,360 acres in Nellore district and 1,24 lakh acres in Tirupati district

title: It will be a new Vande Bharat Express from Belagavi not an extension, says Shettar
content: Contrary to the decision to extend the existing Dharwad-Bengaluru Vande Bharat Express, the Railway Board will run a new train

title: Basavanna represents all communities not just Lingayats, says Kore
content: He was inaugurating the Basaveshwara Jayanti programme organised by Sri Basaveshwara Study Chair of Karnatak University in Dharwad

title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet lauds Operation Sindoor
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu discusses coastal security with the Ministers and advises them to remain vigilant on the issue

title: Pro-Synod group told not to defeat peace efforts
content: The One Qurbana, One Church movement, which came under official Church criticism, said it would not allow Mar Pamplany to carry out what the group claimed was ‚Äúanti-Church consensus formula‚Äù in the Mass issue

title: TCS, JNTU Manthani collaborate for upskilling programme
content: Pilot phase will have 100 students, who will undergo a 20-week immersive training programme designed to bridge the gap between academia and industry¬†

title: Enter Sandman: Metallica brings seismic shift to Virginia Tech stadium
content: over 60,000 fans gathered at Virginia Tech's Lane Stadium for a night that created ground tremors . the iconic metal band finally brought their song "Enter Sandman" in front of this dedicated fan base . it was so well-received that it brought a seismic shift to the stadium .

title: Panthers cut Clowney; RB Brooks out for season
content: the Carolina Panthers are moving on from three-time pro Bowl edge rusher Jadeveon Clowney . it was one of several moves announced by the Panthers before the start of their rookie minicamp . he will miss the entire 2025 season as he recovers from his second injury to his right knee .

title: Pahalgam attack: India flays Pak for opposing TRF mention in UN statement
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Annoyed' Arteta says best team in UCL 'are out'
content: alejandro Moreno slams arsenal for their dependence on set pieces after their exit . the gunners won 2-1 on goals from Fabi√°n Ruiz and Achraf Hakimi to complete a 3-1 aggregate victory . a 69th-minute penalty for a handball by myles Lewis-Skelly was awarded on VAR review .

title: Arsenal can't shake nearly-men tag as PSG's collective wins out
content: Paris Saint-Germain will face internazionale in the UEFA champions league final on may 31 . fabi√°n Ruiz's first-half goal and Achraf Hakimi's strike in the second half put PSG on course for the final in Munich . Bukayo Saka 's 76th-minute goal gave the Gunners hope of a late comeback .

title: Grading the George Pickens trade: How the Cowboys, Steelers fared
content: the Dallas Cowboys agreed to a trade for wide receiver George Pickens . they will send a 2026 third-round pick and a 2527 fifth-round picked to the Pittsburgh Steelers . pickens is an excellent fit with Lamb, too .

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players: Wilson No. 1, but where do Collier, Stewart, Clark land?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is here, with preseason games underway and the regular season set to tip May 16 . a'ja Wilson and the Las Vegas Aces have a bit of a new look but remain confident in their core . caitlin Clark is looking to lead the Indiana Fever into title contention .

title: Missing stars and missed 3s: Why the Cavs and Celtics are suddenly in massive holes
content: the Cleveland Cavaliers and Boston Celtics each won 60-plus games . there's no precedent in league history for what we saw in the opening days of the conference semifinals . a week ago, the playoffs ended with a 2-0 lead over the san francisco pacers .

title: Expert picks, best bets: What's Della Maddalena's path to a title win?
content: welterweight champion belal Muhammad is ranked no. 10 on ESPN's pound-for-pound list . he is unbeaten inside the Octagon, reeling off seven consecutive wins . women's flyweight champion Valentina Shevchenko puts her belt on the line against manon Fiorot .

title: How 48 hours recalibrated Draymond Green -- and how it's already impacting Round 2
content: steph Curry's left hamstring injury gave the Golden State Warriors a 30-20 lead . he drilled another 3 from the top of the key, giving the Timberwolves a timeout . "i'll be back," Curry told Green as the point guard walked gingerly toward the tunnel .
